hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash ### assume etl role aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 900 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
mkdir data mkdir data/decoded mkdir completed mkdir hierarchies mkdir processing
find data/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; find processing/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; find completed/ -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; rm -rf pic-sure-hpds/
aws s3 cp ${managed_inputs} data/Managed_Inputs.csv
grep -i ${abv_name^^}, data/Managed_Inputs.csv > data/Managed_Inputs.csv2
mv data/Managed_Inputs.csv2 data/Managed_Inputs.csv
aws s3 cp ${metadata_file} data/metadata.json
aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/general/data/PatientPool.txt data/
unset AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID unset AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY unset AWS_SESSION_TOKEN
aws sts assume-role --duration-seconds 3600 --role-arn arn:aws:iam::736265540791:role/dbgap-etl --role-session-name "s3-test" > assume-role-output.txt
export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=`grep AccessKeyId assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=`grep SecretAccessKey assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"` export AWS_SESSION_TOKEN=`grep SessionToken assume-role-output.txt | cut -d ':' -f 2 | sed "s/[ ,\"]//g"`
aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv data/ --quiet aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/rawData/ beforeConversion/ --recursive --exclude "*" --include "*data_dict.xml*" --include "${stdy_id}*subject.multi*" --include "${stdy_id}*Subject.Multi*" \ --include "${stdy_id}*Subject.MULTI*" --include "${stdy_id}*sample.multi*" --include "${stdy_id}*Sample.Multi*" \ --include "${stdy_id}*Sample.MULTI*"
for file in beforeConversion/*; do echo "$file" FILE_ENCODING=$(file -i $file) iconv -f 8859_1 -t UTF-8//TRANSLIT "$file" -o data/decoded/$(basename $file) done
cp data/* data/decoded/
java -jar jars/HPDSPatientNumTracker.jar
aws s3 cp data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${abv_name,,}/data/${abv_name^^}_PatientMapping.v2.csv aws s3 cp data/PatientPool.txt s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/general/data/PatientPool.txt
